title: 114_hr5033
content: The Joint Resolution increasing the statutory limit on the public debt is amended to identify, consolidate, and eliminate unnecessarily duplicative government programs. The Comptroller General of the United States conducts routine investigations to identify and report on programs with duplicative goals and activities. The annual report to Congress includes cost estimates of unnecessary duplication and recommendations for consolidation and elimination to reduce redundancy. The Comptroller General identifies and reports on unnecessary duplication in programs, providing cost estimates and recommendations for consolidation and elimination to reduce redundancy. SEC. 4. IMPROVEMENTS TO ELIMINATION OF UNNECESSARY DUPLICATION. Systematic Agency Review of Operations in title 5, United States Code is amended to include informing agency processes for learning and decision-making, assessing opportunities for coordination and reducing duplication, and improving performance towards agency missions. The amendment to Section 1123(b) of title 31, United States Code, includes adding evaluation and risk management to the responsibilities of Chief Operating Officers. It also addresses crosscutting program and management issues using an enterprise risk management approach. Additionally, it focuses on improving coordination and reducing duplication within and external to the agency. The amendment to Section 1115 of title 31, United States Code, includes adding evaluation and risk management responsibilities to agency performance plans. It also addresses unnecessary duplication in crosscutting program and management issues. The amendment to Section 1115 of title 31, United States Code adds evaluation and risk management responsibilities to agency performance plans, addressing unnecessary duplication in crosscutting program and management issues. It also defines 'enterprise risk management' as processes to address risks across multiple programs and organizations within a larger entity. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of 'risk' and 'risk management' in relation to achieving the missions, goals, and objectives of a department, agency, or program. It outlines the processes involved in identifying, assessing, prioritizing, monitoring, mitigating, and reporting on risks. The curr_chunk amends Section 1120 of title 31, United States Code, regarding Federal Government and Agency Priority Goals. It includes adjustments to paragraphs (1)(B) and (3) to consider recommendations from the Government Accountability Office. The curr_chunk amends Section 1124 of title 31, United States Code, by adjusting subsections related to Performance Improvement Officers and the Performance Improvement Council. The curr_chunk amends Section 1124 of title 31, United States Code, by adjusting subsections related to Performance Improvement Officers and the Performance Improvement Council. It includes changes such as collaboration with agency components, evaluation, risk management, coordination issues, engagement with non-Federal stakeholders, and mission support. The curr_chunk adds provisions for a public website and detailed annual report for the Performance Improvement Council, including structure, budget, staffing, and other relevant details. The curr_chunk involves amending sections of the United States Code related to agency reporting, including the elimination of unnecessary reporting and requirements for agency reports. The United States Code is amended to include additional reporting requirements for agencies, such as the annual report on duplicative goals and the High Risk list from the Government Accountability Office.
